2 Vocal FX 2.1 Vocoder 2.1.1 Summary A vocoder synthesises speech. It analyses a ‘modulation’ signal (speech) and uses this to apply filters to the ‘carrier’ signal (a synthesiser output). A vocoder can sound more realistic by increasing the number of filter bands. 2.1.2 Examples Bob Moog and Wendy Carlos developed an early vocoder for Clockwork Orange (1970). The vocoder was popular in the late 1970s and early 1980s: ELO: ‘Mr Blue Sky’ (1977) Kraftwerk: ‘The Robots’ (1978) 2.1.3 Quick Logic tutorial
